abstract: News that John C. Malone is seeking a 35 percent stake in the company to be formed by the freshly approved merger of Ticketmaster and Live Nation, has The New York Post pitying Live Nation Entertainment’s chief executive.
snippet: News that John C. Malone is seeking a 35 percent stake in the company to be formed by the freshly approved merger of Ticketmaster and Live Nation, has The New York Post pitying Live Nation Entertainment’s chief executive.
lead_paragraph: News that John C. Malone is seeking a 35 percent stake in the company to be formed by the freshly approved merger of Ticketmaster and Live Nation, has The New York Post pitying Live Nation Entertainment‘s chief executive, Michael Rapino.

headline.main: Who’s Afraid of Malone’s Live Nation Move?
